Finding your perfect travel companion may be as simple as logging on to your Facebook account.
The brand new Holiday Matchmaker Facebook App analyses a user's 'likes' to ascertain their traveller personality profile.
With just one click, social media savvy holidaymakers will learn exactly what kind of traveller they are, be shown handpicked destinations best suited to their travel style and even recommend friends that would make the most compatible travel companions.
Hilton's new Holiday Matchmaker Facebook App analyses a user's 'likes' to ascertain their travel personality
The first-of-its-kind app was created by the University of Cambridge and Hilton Hotels.
Researchers at the university's Psychometrics Centre developed a series of predictive algorithms using data from more than six million global participants.

Using the big five personality traits - openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness and neuroticism - the matchmaker app can recommend destinations, suggest activities upon arrival and also suggest most and least compatible co-traveller types.
For example, some users may be categorised as 'Thrill-seekers' - defined by high extraversion and an enthusiasm for meeting new people while travelling.
The app also delivers these trait predictions and the individual's travel persona without retaining or sharing any personal user data.
The app is able to suggest dream destinations, like the Hilton Mauritius (pictured), and suggest activities
'Consumers are almost spoilt for choice in today's travel market,' said Aligi Gardenghi, vice president of marketing, EMEA, Hilton Worldwide.
'The Holiday Matchmaker Facebook App avoids that one-holiday-fits-all approach to suggest a bespoke location based on some pretty heavyweight technology behind the scenes.
'Thanks to the researchers at the University of Cambridge Psychometrics Centre, we can recommend destinations and other experiences based on a deeper, psychological understanding of our audience for the very first time.'
Once you've found your travel persona, it can be shared on Facebook, Twitter and through email
Once their travel persona has been revealed, users can share and compare it with their Facebook friends, Twitter followers and email contacts from within the app, harnessing social media to help them create shared holiday experiences even before they book their trip.
The launch of such revolutionary new technology also coincides with the Hilton Summer Sale, which means that once you broadcast your results, you can quickly and easily book your dream trip.
From May 22 through September 27, weekend holidays to Europe, the Middle East and Africa are up to 30 per cent off.
